CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 9, 1953, pg. 32, reads: "E. L. Smith, Builder, From Blueprint To New Community - New Homes Are News - Few Pittsburgh Negroes have ever had the privilege of living in a new home. Within recent years, E. L. Smith has built more new homes for Negroes than any other local building contractor. Operating principally on the East End - Penn Township sector, he has sparked the emergence of a new community in this area.  Here our photographer has taken pictures of phases of the Smith operation, as he converts raw land into a setting for graceful living. - Harris Photos."  "Down to Rock - There is no more vital part of a house than its foundation.  Here Pete Sharp and Sol Jones set one."
TitMainTitle: Pete Sharp and Sol Jones working on foundation of house at construction site, with another man, possibly Edgar Lee Smith looking down from edge, with piles of cinder block, small block building, and trees in background, possibly East End
